lead_paragraph: The American health care system is ill prepared — in its attitudes, equipment and common practices — to treat the rising population of fat patients.

headline.print_headline: Dangers Lurk for Obese Patients  When Doctors See Only Weight
headline.main: Why Do Obese Patients Get Worse Care? Many Doctors Don’t See Past the Fat

snippet: The American health care system is ill prepared — in its attitudes, equipment and common practices — to treat the rising population of fat patients....
abstract: American medical system remains ill-equipped to treat rising number of obese patients, problem reflected in practices, equipment and attitudes of medical professionals; compounding problem is frequent unwillingness to look beyond patient's weight and tendency to blame all health problems on obesity, missing serious conditions unrelated to weight (Series: The Science of Fat).
